item.content:encoded: Are you new to PHP or need a refresher?Then this course will help you get all the fundamentals of Procedural PHP, Object Oriented PHP, MYSQLi and ending the course by building a CMS system similar to WordPress, Joomla or Drupal. Knowing PHP has allowed me to make enough money to stay home and make courses like this one for students all over the world.Being a PHP developer can allow anyone to make really good money online and offline, developing dynamic applications. KnowingPHPwill allow you to build web applications, websites or Content Management systems, like WordPress, Facebook, Twitter or even Google. There is no limit to what you can do with this knowledge.PHP is one of the most important web programming languages to learn, and knowing it, will give youSUPER POWERSin the web development world and job market place. Why? Because Millions of websites and applications (the majority) use PHP. You can find a job anywhere or even work on your own, online and in places like freelancer or Odesk. You can definitely make a substantial income once you learn it. I will not bore you :) I take my courses very seriously but at the same time I try to make it fun since I know how difficult learning from an instructor with a monotone voice or boring attitude is. This course is fun, and when you need some energy to keep going, you will get it from me. My Approach Practice, practice and more practice. Every section inside this course has a practice lecture at the end, reinforcing everything with went over in the lectures. I also created a small application the you will be able to download to help you practice PHP. To top it off, we will build and awesome CMS like WordPress, Joomla or Drupal.

item.title: The Art Of Music
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Our music course offers a comprehensive and in-depth study of the subject, covering everything from music theory and composition to performance and history.
You will learn to understand the technical aspects of music such as scales, chords, and harmonic progressions, as well as develop your listening and performance skills by learning to play an instrument or sing.
You will also explore the rich history of music and discover how it has evolved over time. Additionally, you will also get an opportunity to learn and create music using technology-focused program and music production software.
The course also includes Music psychology which will help you to understand how music affects the brain and the emotions. Our expert instructors will guide you every step of the way, providing the support and resources you need to become a successful musician

item.title: Art History Renaissance to 20th Century
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
The history of art from 1300 to the 20th Century
This is part two of a year-long college-level survey course in art history. This course covers art history from the European Renaissance around 1300 A.D. until the Mid 20th Century
This course is designed as a basic college-level survey of art history. I provide an online textbook as well as study guides and worksheets. This course covers the language used to discuss art. A complete overview of art, culture, and architecture from the Renaissance to the 1950s.
Each work is covered in depth, the works physical or formal properties are discussed such as technology used to create the work, color, medium, materials, composition, and shading.
The symbolism of each work is discussed and how to interpret the interrelationship of symbols in a work of art.
This course is the actual content of a course I teach at an accredited college in California called Ohlone college.
I designed this course as a series of clear, non-jargon laden video lectures and texts designed to help any student who wants to pass AP art history and or any beginning level art history survey course.
This course now has professionally created captions in English on 98% of all the videos.
item.excerpt:encoded: This is an actual college level course that is taught at several accredited colleges.

Just the internet and a browser

item.title: Graphic Design Masterclass
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: Graphic Design Master Class Do you want to learn all the skills and techniques you need to create incredible designs? Do you want to know the process of creatinglogosandbranding packages? Are you intimidated by learningphotoshop, illustrator or InDesignand want to learn through practicalreal worldprojects?Than This class will be for you! We will extensively reviewTypography, color theory, layout and composition, how to use photos in design, photo manipulations and editing and magazine layout design,branding and logo designjust to name a few. We also learn the basics ofAdobe Photoshop, illustrator and InDesignand do projects with real world applications. Every designer needs to know and master these programs and this course makes sure you know the essential tools to power through amazing projects. InAdobe Photoshop,we will review photo editing and manipulation techniques like how to cut objects out, duotones, changing color on objects, the liquify tool and we will create a compelling YouTube thumbnail with our newly learned photoshop skills as well as an entire book cover design project. InAdobe Illustrator, we will master the pen tool by hand tracing simple and complex shapes. We will explore the power of the shape builder tool and In the end of this section, we will design acomplete logo design. There is an entirely new introduction and tools section that has been added where we work through a7 page vector tracing worksheetand in the end create a complex vector illustration using our newly learned illustrator vector tools. Lastly, we will put together anevent flyerto practice our layout skills, and even work through thebranding process and create a logo, business card and letterhead for a business. We will willcreate a magazine layout inInDesignand learn the master pages tool to drastically speed up your design workflow when working with multiple paged layouts. We will talk about branding basics, what makes a good logo? How do you extend your logo or brand to other marketing materials? I designed this extensive course to be gentle enough for new comers to design but detailed enough for everyone to get aTONout of this course.

item.title: Mimi Coloring Course
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Looking to unleash your creativity and bring your coloring skills to the next level? Our comprehensive coloring online course has everything you need to master this beautiful art form! Here's what you'll learn:
  1. Get familiar with all the latest tools and materials: From colored pencils to watercolors and markers, you'll learn how to use the best tools for the job.
  2. Master coloring techniques like a pro: Learn how to blend, shade, and layer to create stunning works of art that truly pop.
  3. Know your colors like the back of your hand: With our color theory and color wheel lessons, you'll always choose the right hues for the job.
  4. Practice, practice, practice: We'll provide you with a range of subjects to color, from portraits to landscapes, still life, and more.
  5. Make your colors sing: Our tips and tricks for color correction and improvement will ensure that your artwork always looks its best.
  6. Try your hand at different mediums: With lessons on working with markers, colored pencils, watercolors, and more, you'll be able to choose the perfect medium for your artwork.
  7. Create a unique style all your own: Our lessons on developing your own unique coloring style will help you find your voice and make your work stand out.
  8. Design like a pro: With our lessons on composition and design principles, your coloring will be as well-designed as it is beautiful.
So what are you waiting for? Enroll in our coloring online course today and start creating stunning works of art!

item.title: Sculpting in Clay and Ceramic
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Unleash your inner artist and create stunning three-dimensional objects with our comprehensive Sculpting in Clay and Ceramic online course! Here's what you can expect to learn:
  1. Get your hands dirty: From the very first lesson, you'll start working with clay and ceramics to create beautiful objects.
  2. Learn the fundamentals: Get a thorough understanding of the properties of clay and ceramics and how to mold, shape and form them.
  3. Master the art of hand-building, wheel-throwing and slip-casting: Our lessons will guide you through these essential techniques and give you the skills to create anything you can imagine.
  4. Decorate and glaze like a pro: Learn how to decorate your creations and give them a protective, glossy finish that will last for years to come.
  5. Fire and finish with confidence: Our lessons will teach you about bisque firing and glaze firing, so you can finish your work with professional results.
  6. Immerse yourself in the world of ceramics: From ancient traditions to modern techniques, you'll learn about the rich history and diversity of ceramics from around the world.
  7. Find your unique voice: With lessons on developing your own style and expressing your creativity, you'll be able to create objects that are truly one-of-a-kind.
So what are you waiting for? Sign up for our Sculpting in Clay and Ceramic online course today and start sculpting your dreams into reality!

Transform your design skills and create engaging digital experiences with our cutting-edge UI/UX online course! Here's what you can expect to learn:

  7. Keep up with the latest trends: Stay ahead of the curve with lessons on the latest UI/UX design trends and technologies.
  8. Launch your career as a UI/UX designer: With lessons on how to create a portfolio and land your first job, you'll be ready to start your career as a UI/UX designer in no time.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to level up your design skills and create digital experiences that are both beautiful and user-friendly. Enroll in our UI/UX online course today!

item.title: Mastering Watercolor Techniques
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: Unlock your full creative potential with our "Mastering Watercolor Techniques" online course! Discover the beauty and versatility of watercolor painting and learn how to create stunning works of art with this timeless medium. Under the guidance of expert instructors, you'll explore the fundamentals of watercolor painting, including color theory, composition, and brush techniques. You'll also learn advanced techniques such as wet-on-wet, layering, and glazing, allowing you to add depth and dimension to your paintings. With step-by-step demonstrations and hands-on exercises, you'll have the opportunity to put your new skills into practice and develop your own unique style. Don't miss this opportunity to become a master of watercolor painting! Enroll now and unleash your inner artist!

Knowing PHP has allowed me to make enough money to stay home and make courses like this one for students all over the world.Being a PHP developer can allow anyone to make really good money online and offline, developing dynamic applications. KnowingPHPwill allow you to build web applications, websites or Content Management systems, like WordPress, Facebook, Twitter or even Google. There is no limit to what you can do with this knowledge.PHP is one of the most important web programming languages to learn, and knowing it, will give youSUPER POWERSin the web development world and job market place. Why? Because Millions of websites and applications (the majority) use PHP. You can find a job anywhere or even work on your own, online and in places like freelancer or Odesk. You can definitely make a substantial income once you learn it. I will not bore you :) I take my courses very seriously but at the same time I try to make it fun since I know how difficult learning from an instructor with a monotone voice or boring attitude is. This course is fun, and when you need some energy to keep going, you will get it from me. My Approach Practice, practice and more practice. Every section inside this course has a practice lecture at the end, reinforcing everything with went over in the lectures. I also created a small application the you will be able to download to help you practice PHP. To top it off, we will build and awesome CMS like WordPress, Joomla or Drupal.

item.excerpt:encoded: Do you want to learn the number #1 programming language that powers the internet? Are you tired of wasting your time and money on random youtube videos or JavaScript courses that are either too simple, or too difficult to follow? No coding experience is necessary to take this course! I take you from beginner to expert! Any computer and OS will work Windows, macOS or Linux. We will set up your text editor the course. item.excerpt:encoded: This course will guide you through every single step from installation to finished website. I'll show you how you can install Wordpress on your own computer for free, so you don't have to pay for a domain name or hosting fees while you complete this course. Once you've got Wordpress installed on your computer, you will learn how to build and run a successful, beautiful, responsive-design website you can be proud of.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Know how to configure Wordpress for best results Understand plugins & themes and how to find/install them Protect their Wordpress website from hackers and spammers Create a static homepage useful for most websites, or a blog like homepage useful for bloggers. Create an affiliate site for passive, recurring income Create a Responsive Website that looks good on any browser

No prior knowledge of Wordpress is required as everything will be covered in this course. You will need a working computer and a web browser connected to the internet.. You don't need any coding experience at all. That is the beauty of Wordpress.

If you want to learn Wordpress without paying for a web host, this course is perfect. I'll show you how you can install Wordpress on your very own computer while you learn. This course is for you if you want to build a website, whether for personal or business reasons. If you want to learn to master Wordpress without getting bogged down with technical jargon, this course is for you. If you want to get step-by-step, over-the-shoulder tuition from an ex-school teacher who has been using and teaching Wordpress since 2004. This course is perfect for you if you are taking over an existing Wordpress website, or want to build one from scratch, but don't know where to start. This course is for anyone that wants to be the Wordpress goto guy or gal.

Hannah Montanas

Lovely & Legible Lettering

Do you ever scroll through images of beautiful lettering on Instagram and think to yourself that if you could do the same?

item.title: Basic Fundamentals
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Here are the basic fundamentals you'll learn!

Proportions
The human body follows a set of proportions, such as the ratio of the head to the body, or the length of the limbs in relation to the torso.

Skeletal Structure
The skeleton is the foundation of the human body and understanding its structure and how to affects the muscles is important for creating believable poses and movements.

Gesture
The way the body is positioned and moves can convey emotions and actions, and undertanding gesture is important for creating dynamic and expressive figures.

Light and Shadow
The way light falls on the body can affect the way it is perceived, and understanding how to use light and shadow can add depth and realism to a figure

Perspective
Understanding how to use pespective can add depth to a figure and make it appear more 3 Dimensional.

Observation
It is important to observe real people, and study the shapes shadows, and texture of the human body in order to draw figures that are accurate and believable.

item.title: Head Part
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
1. Start by drawing a basic shape for the head, such as an oval or a circle. This will serve as a guide for the rest of the features.

  2. Next, add the basic shapes for the eyes, nose, and mouth. The eyes are typically located on the upper half of the head and are roughly the same size and shape. The nose is located between the eyes and mouth, and the mouth is located on the lower half of the head.

  3. Add the ears, which are typically located on either side of the head, just above the eyes. Ears are typically a little bit longer than the width of the eye.

  4. Sketch the basic shape of the hair and add any details such as bangs or cowlicks.

  5. Sketch the basic shape of the neck and shoulders.

  6. Add details such as wrinkles, creases, and shadows to give the face more depth and realism.

  7. Finally, refine the lines, making sure that the features are in the correct proportion and placement.

item.title: Typeface and font selection
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: In this lesson, students learn about the different categories of typefaces (such as serif, sans-serif, and script) and how to choose the right typeface for different projects. They also learn about the different variations within a typeface family (such as bold, italic, and condensed) and how to use them effectively.

item.title: Typographic hierarchy
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: In this lesson, students learn about the importance of creating a clear hierarchy of information in their designs. They learn how to use type size, weight, and placement to create emphasis and guide the viewer's eye through the design.

item.title: Kerning and tracking
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: In this lesson, students learn about the spacing between letters (kerning) and the overall spacing of a block of text (tracking). They learn how to adjust these settings to create a more cohesive and visually pleasing design.

item.title: Line spacing and leading
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: In this lesson, students learn about the spacing between lines of text (line spacing or leading). They learn how to adjust these settings to create a more legible and visually pleasing design.

item.title: Grid systems
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: In this lesson, students learn about the use of grid systems in typographic layout. They learn how to use grids to create consistent and visually pleasing layouts, and how to adapt grids to different design projects.

item.title: Digital typography
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded: This lesson covers the use of web fonts, responsive design, and how to prepare typography for digital media.

item.title: The Theory of Music
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
1. Musical notation: A system of symbols and signs used to represent musical sounds and rhythms in written form.

  2. Scales: A sequence of musical notes arranged in ascending or descending order, often used as the foundation for melodies and harmonies.

  3. Chords: A combination of three or more musical notes played or sung at the same time, which creates a harmonic sound.

  4. Harmony: The combination of notes played or sung at the same time, creating a chordal structure in music.

  5. Melody: A sequence of musical notes played or sung in a specific order, often used as the main theme or subject of a piece of music.

  6. Rhythm: The pattern of beats in a piece of music, which gives it its overall flow and structure.

  7. Timbre: The unique sound of a particular instrument or voice, characterized by its tonal quality, texture, and overtone content.

  8. Harmony progression: The way in which chords change and relate to each other in a piece of music.

  9. Key: A particular scale or set of pitches that serves as the foundation for a piece of music.

  10. Form: The overall structure and organization of a piece of music, including the arrangement of sections and elements such as melody, harmony, and rhythm.

item.title: History of music
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
1. Ancient music: Music has been present since prehistoric times, with evidence of musical instruments dating back to ancient civilizations such as Egypt and Mesopotamia.

  2. Medieval music: Music during the Middle Ages was primarily religious in nature and was often performed in churches. The most important form of medieval music was plainchant, also known as Gregorian chant.

  3. Renaissance music: The Renaissance saw the emergence of polyphony, the simultaneous performance of two or more independent melodies, and the development of new forms of vocal and instrumental music.

  4. Baroque music: Baroque music, which emerged in the late 16th century, was characterized by grandiose melodies, elaborate counterpoint, and ornate harmonies.

  5. Classical music: The 18th and 19th centuries saw the emergence of classical music, characterized by its balance, clarity, and emotional restraint.

  6. Romantic music: Romantic music, which emerged in the 19th century, was characterized by its emphasis on emotion, personal expression, and the use of unconventional harmonic progressions.

  7. 20th century music: 20th century music saw the emergence of many new forms and styles, including jazz, blues, rock and roll, and electronic music.

  8. Contemporary music: The 21st century has seen the emergence of diverse forms of contemporary music, including hip hop, electronic dance music (EDM), and various forms of world music.

item.title: creating melodies,
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Melody refers to a sequence of musical notes played or sung in a specific order, often used as the main theme or subject of a piece of music. It's the linear aspect of music, the part that you can sing or hum.

There are several ways to create melody in music, such as:

  1. Using a specific scale or mode: A melody is often built around a specific scale or mode, which provides a set of notes to choose from.

  2. Repetition and variation: Creating a melody by repeating and varying a simple phrase or motif can add interest and structure to the melody.

  3. Using intervals: The distance between two notes is called an interval, and different intervals can create different emotions and feelings in a melody.

  4. Combining melody and harmony: A melody can be enhanced by adding harmony, which is the combination of notes played or sung at the same time.

  5. Experimenting with rhythm and phrasing: Experimenting with different rhythms and phrasing can add interest and variety to a melody.

  6. Using non-traditional melodies: Creating melody using unconventional methods such as using noises, spoken words, or using unconventional scales.

  7. Inspiration: Composers often draw inspiration from various sources such as nature, people, or other art forms.

item.title: creating harmonies
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Harmony refers to the combination of notes played or sung at the same time, creating a chordal structure in music. When multiple notes are played together, they create a harmonic sound that can add depth and complexity to a piece of music.

There are several ways to create harmony in music, such as:

  1. Chord Progressions: This involves the use of chords that change and relate to each other in a specific pattern, creating a sense of movement and structure in a piece of music.

  2. Counterpoint: This involves the use of two or more melodies that are played or sung at the same time, creating a complex and interesting harmonic texture.

  3. Voice leading: This involves the movement of individual voices within a chord progression, creating a smooth and seamless transition between chords.

  4. Modulation: This involves the changing of keys in a piece of music, creating a sense of tension and release and adding interest to the piece.

  5. Drones: A drone is a sustained tone that is played or sung in the background of a piece of music, creating a sense of harmony and stability.

  6. Polyphony: It's a technique of creating harmony by overlaying different melodies and rhythms on top of each other.

  7. Harmony can also be created by manipulating various elements such as rhythm, timbre, and dynamics

item.title: chord progressions.
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
A chord progression refers to the sequence of chords used in a piece of music. Chords provide harmonic support and give a sense of movement and structure to a piece of music.

There are several ways to create chord progressions, such as:

  1. Using a specific key or scale: Many chord progressions are built around a specific key or scale, which provides a set of chords to choose from.

  2. Using common chord progressions: There are many common chord progressions that are used in music such as I-IV-V, I-V-vi-IV, and ii-V-I.

  3. Using chord inversions: Chord inversions involve changing the order of notes in a chord, which can add interest and variety to a chord progression.

  4. Experimenting with different chord types: Experimenting with different chord types such as minor, diminished, or augmented chords can add interest and tension to a chord progression.

  5. Using modulations: Modulation involves changing the key or tonality of a piece of music, which can add interest and variety to a chord progression.

  6. Using secondary dominants: Secondary dominants are chords that temporarily change the tonality of a piece of music, adding tension and release to a chord progression.

  7. Using non-traditional chord progressions: Creating chord progressions using unconventional methods

item.title: how music affects the listener
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Music has the ability to affect listeners in a variety of ways, both emotionally and physically. Some of the ways that music can affect listeners include:

  1. Emotional response: Music has the ability to evoke a wide range of emotions in listeners, from happiness and joy to sadness and nostalgia.

  2. Mood enhancement: Music has been shown to have a positive effect on mood, helping to reduce stress, anxiety, and depression.

  3. Memory: Music can serve as a powerful tool for triggering memories and emotions, reminding listeners of past experiences and people.

  4. Physical response: Music can also have a physical effect on listeners, causing changes in heart rate, blood pressure, and respiration.

  5. Behavioral response: Music has been known to influence behavior, whether it's to dance or to be more relaxed.

  6. Social interactions: Music can also serve as a way for people to connect with others and create a sense of community.

  7. Influence on the brain: Music can affect the way the brain processes information, and it can have therapeutic effects on individuals with certain conditions like Alzheimer's, autism and depression.

  8. Cultural influence: Music can also reflect and influence the culture of society and can serve as a way to preserve cultural traditions.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://artatouie.epizy.com.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Refund and Returns Policy
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
This is a sample page.

Overview

Our refund and returns policy lasts 30 days. If 30 days have passed since your purchase, we cant offer you a full refund or exchange.

To be eligible for a return, your item must be unused and in the same condition that you received it. It must also be in the original packaging.

Several types of goods are exempt from being returned. Perishable goods such as food, flowers, newspapers or magazines cannot be returned. We also do not accept products that are intimate or sanitary goods, hazardous materials, or flammable liquids or gases.

Additional non-returnable items:

  • Gift cards
  • Downloadable software products
  • Some health and personal care items

To complete your return, we require a receipt or proof of purchase.

Please do not send your purchase back to the manufacturer.

There are certain situations where only partial refunds are granted:

  • Book with obvious signs of use
  • CD, DVD, VHS tape, software, video game, cassette tape, or vinyl record that has been opened.
  • Any item not in its original condition, is damaged or missing parts for reasons not due to our error.
  • Any item that is returned more than 30 days after delivery

Refunds

Once your return is received and inspected, we will send you an email to notify you that we have received your returned item. We will also notify you of the approval or rejection of your refund.

If you are approved, then your refund will be processed, and a credit will automatically be applied to your credit card or original method of payment, within a certain amount of days.

Late or missing refunds

If you havent received a refund yet, first check your bank account again.

Then contact your credit card company, it may take some time before your refund is officially posted.

Next contact your bank. There is often some processing time before a refund is posted.

If youve done all of this and you still have not received your refund yet, please contact us at {email address}.

Sale items

Only regular priced items may be refunded. Sale items cannot be refunded.

Exchanges

We only replace items if they are defective or damaged. If you need to exchange it for the same item, send us an email at {email address} and send your item to: {physical address}.

Gifts

If the item was marked as a gift when purchased and shipped directly to you, youll receive a gift credit for the value of your return. Once the returned item is received, a gift certificate will be mailed to you.

If the item wasnt marked as a gift when purchased, or the gift giver had the order shipped to themselves to give to you later, we will send a refund to the gift giver and they will find out about your return.

Shipping returns

To return your product, you should mail your product to: {physical address}.

You will be responsible for paying for your own shipping costs for returning your item. Shipping costs are non-refundable. If you receive a refund, the cost of return shipping will be deducted from your refund.

Depending on where you live, the time it may take for your exchanged product to reach you may vary.

If you are returning more expensive items, you may consider using a trackable shipping service or purchasing shipping insurance. We dont guarantee that we will receive your returned item.

Need help?

Contact us at {email} for questions related to refunds and returns.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: https://preview.tutorlms.com/starter.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitors IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.dc:creator: marcie

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Admission
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Admission

Home > Bachelor Of Science in Business Administration

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yGDwk4z9EEg

Email us

info@mail.com

support@mail.com

Visit us

34 Madison Street,

NY, USA 10005

Guides to undergraduate study

Doubling my 95 salary several times in my career is something I never thought would happen. My career went from startup land to call center operator in a short space of time.

That meant going from six-figures down to the minimum wage in my home country of Australia. And to top it off, I have no degrees in anything business related unless you count a sound engineering qualification.

If an uneducated guy from the home of the Kangaroo can double their salary, there is definitely hope for you. Popular career websites like Seek suggest the typical advice about doing better in your performance review or getting more education from a university. This advice is out of date and I have watched many colleagues fall for this trap and only end up disappointed.

Doubling your salary, or at the very least increasing it significantly, is about breaking the norm and trying a few things that are a bit more radical as youre about to see with these simple tips below.

The goal should be more than money

Okay so you can make more money but if thats your only goal, the extra zeroes on your bank balance will get really boring real quick.

Applying to University

item.title: Godfather lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Godfather ipsum dolor sit amet. It's a Sicilian message. It means Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes. In Sicily, women are more dangerous than shotguns. Is that why you slapped my brother around in public? Do me this favor. I won't forget it. Ask your friends in the neighborhood about me. They'll tell you I know how to return a favor.

It's not personal. It's business. I know it was you, Fredo. You broke my heart. You broke my heart! Te salut, Don Corleone. Fredo, you're my older brother, and I love you. But don't ever take sides with anyone against the Family again. Ever. I want your answer and the money by noon tomorrow. And one more thing. Don't you contact me again, ever. From now on, you deal with Turnbull.

Vito, how do you like my little angel? Isn't she beautiful? You can act like a man! Your enemies always get strong on what you leave behind. I see you took the name of the town. What was your father's name? What's the matter with you? Is this what you've become, a Hollywood finocchio who cries like a woman? "Oh, what do I do? What do I do?" What is that nonsense? Ridiculous!

Leave the gun. Take the cannoli. Don't you know that I would use all of my power to prevent something like that from happening? Why do you hurt me, Michael? I've always been loyal to you. What's wrong with being a lawyer?

Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment. Friends and money - oil and water. I don't feel I have to wipe everybody out, Tom. Just my enemies. Never let anyone know what you are thinking.

item.title: Please don't tell me you're innocent
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Godfather ipsum dolor sit amet. My father is no different than any powerful man, any man with power, like a president or senator. Why did you go to the police? Why didn't you come to me first? Only don't tell me you're innocent. Because it insults my intelligence and makes me very angry. My father's name was Antonio Andolini and this is for you.

Don't you know that I would use all of my power to prevent something like that from happening? Friends and money - oil and water. Why do you hurt me, Michael? I've always been loyal to you. Sonny, please don't do anything. Please don't do anything.

You talk about vengeance. Is vengeance going to bring your son back to you? Or my boy to me? In Sicily, women are more dangerous than shotguns. Don't ever give an order like that again. Not while I'm alive. Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment. Michael, you never told me you knew Johnny Fontane!

Leave the gun. Take the cannoli. Don Corleone, I am honored and grateful that you have invited me to your home on the wedding day of your daughter. And may their first child be a masculine child. I don't like violence, Tom. I'm a businessman; blood is a big expense. I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse. Very well. You want to do business with me. I will do business with you.

It's a Sicilian message. It means Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes. I want your answer and the money by noon tomorrow. And one more thing. Don't you contact me again, ever. From now on, you deal with Turnbull. I don't feel I have to wipe everybody out, Tom. Just my enemies. Hey, listen, I want somebody good - and I mean very good - to plant that gun. I don't want my brother coming out of that toilet with just his dick in his hands, alright?

item.title: Ask your friends in the neighborhood about me
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Godfather ipsum dolor sit amet. Do me this favor. I won't forget it. Ask your friends in the neighborhood about me. They'll tell you I know how to return a favor. I don't feel I have to wipe everybody out, Tom. Just my enemies. What's the matter with you, huh? What am I going to do? Am I going to make that baby an orphan before he's born? I'm your older brother, Mike, and I was stepped over! What's the matter with you? Is this what you've become, a Hollywood finocchio who cries like a woman? "Oh, what do I do? What do I do?" What is that nonsense? Ridiculous!

Hey, listen, I want somebody good - and I mean very good - to plant that gun. I don't want my brother coming out of that toilet with just his dick in his hands, alright? Is that why you slapped my brother around in public? Fredo, you're my older brother, and I love you. But don't ever take sides with anyone against the Family again. Ever. In Sicily, women are more dangerous than shotguns.

The hotel, the casino. The Corleone Family wants to buy you out. Why do you hurt me, Michael? I've always been loyal to you. Only don't tell me you're innocent. Because it insults my intelligence and makes me very angry. I don't like violence, Tom. I'm a businessman; blood is a big expense.

I am sorry. What happened to your father was business. I have much respect for your father. But your father, his thinking is old-fashioned. You must understand why I had to do that. Now let's work through where we go from here. It's an old habit. I spent my whole life trying not to be careless. Women and children can afford to be careless, but not men. When they come they come at what you love. I see you took the name of the town. What was your father's name? Friends and money - oil and water.

My father taught me many things here - he taught me in this room. He taught me: keep your friends close, but your enemies closer. I have a sentimental weakness for my children and I spoil them, as you can see. They talk when they should listen. Don Corleone, I am honored and grateful that you have invited me to your home on the wedding day of your daughter. And may their first child be a masculine child. If anything in this life is certain, if history has taught us anything, it is that you can kill anyone.

item.title: You broke my heart. You broke my heart!
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:

item.title: How To Blow Through Capital At An Incredible Rate
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Doubling my 95 salary several times in my career is something I never thought would happen. My career went from startup land to call center operator in a short space of time.

That meant going from six-figures down to the minimum wage in my home country of Australia. And to top it off, I have no degrees in anything business related unless you count a sound engineering qualification.

If an uneducated guy from the home of the Kangaroo can double their salary, there is definitely hope for you. Popular career websites like Seek suggest the typical advice about doing better in your performance review or getting more education from a university. This advice is out of date and I have watched many colleagues fall for this trap and only end up disappointed.

Doubling your salary, or at the very least increasing it significantly, is about breaking the norm and trying a few things that are a bit more radical as youre about to see with these simple tips below.

The goal should be more than money

Okay so you can make more money but if thats your only goal, the extra zeroes on your bank balance will get really boring real quick.

You can develop side-businesses, side-hustles, and hobbies that can supplement your 95 income source, and they can all put extra money in your pocket that allows you to work less and not stress so much about bills.

If an uneducated guy from the home of the Kangaroo can double their salary, there is definitely hope for you. Popular career websites like Seek suggest the typical advice about doing better in your performance review or getting more education from a university. This advice is out of date and I have watched many colleagues fall for this trap and only end up disappointed.

item.title: Basic Understanding
item.dc:creator: marcie
item.content:encoded:
Photography is the art and science of capturing light and images on a light-sensitive medium. The basic understanding of photography involves understanding the camera and its components, such as the lens, aperture, shutter speed, and ISO, and how they work together to create an exposure. Good composition, an understanding of light and how it affects your images, and post-processing are also important elements of photography.
Additionally, understanding the historical and cultural context of photography can help inform and enhance your personal practice. Whether for artistic expression, documentarian purposes, or simply capturing memories, photography allows us to freeze a moment in time and tell visual stories. With a basic understanding of photography, you will be equipped with the tools to create meaningful and impactful images.
